text.section:
The Commissioner shall issue a license to each applicant that:
meets the requirements of this subtitle; and
pays the applicable fee for a license for an insurance producer under § 2-112 of this article.

section.section: In this subsection, "controlling person" means a person that directly or indirectly has the power to direct, or cause to be directed, the management, control, or activities of a reinsurance intermediary.

The Commissioner may refuse to issue a license if the Commissioner finds that the applicant, an individual named on the application, a member, principal, officer, or director of the applicant, or a controlling person of the applicant:
is not trustworthy to act as a reinsurance intermediary;
has given cause for revocation or suspension of a license; or
has failed to comply with a requirement for issuance of a license.
On written request, the Commissioner shall provide a summary of the basis for the refusal to issue a license.
The summary of the basis for refusal is privileged and is not a public document under Title 10, Subtitle 6 of the State Government Article.
